ideas:
[NLP] Personalized Narrative Generation for Skill-Based Training: Assessing the Impact of Dynamic Storytelling on User Performance in a Simulated Surgical Environment.
This research will develop a system that dynamically adjusts the narrative elements of a surgical simulation based on the user's performance, aiming to improve skill acquisition and reduce errors. We will measure performance metrics (e.g., successful procedure completion, time to error) and subjective user feedback (through post-simulation questionnaires) to evaluate the effectiveness of this approach. Data will include physiological measures (heart rate, skin conductance) and task-specific performance logs.

[HCI] Interactive Storytelling for Cognitive Rehabilitation – A Gamified Approach

This research will design and evaluate a gamified interactive storytelling experience designed to improve cognitive function in individuals recovering from stroke or dementia. Participants will navigate a narrative-driven story, completing tasks and challenges that require memory recall, attention, and problem-solving skills. We will measure cognitive performance through standardized tests and subjective user feedback, focusing on engagement and perceived difficulty.

[NLP] Contextual Sentiment Analysis of Social Media Posts for Mental Health Support

This research will develop a novel model for analyzing social media posts to identify patterns and sentiment associated with mental health struggles, using a transformer-based architecture. It will leverage a pre-trained model and fine-tune it on a dataset of publicly available social media content, focusing on identifying keywords and phrases indicative of distress. Evaluation will be based on accuracy in sentiment classification and the ability to detect emerging trends in mental health discussions.

[Safety] Federated Learning for Personalized Privacy Protection

This research will explore federated learning techniques to train personalized privacy protection models without directly sharing sensitive user data. The system will utilize differential privacy mechanisms and secure aggregation protocols to train models locally on each user’s device, preserving privacy while still benefiting from personalized features. Data will include user activity logs and device information, and evaluation will focus on accuracy and privacy loss.

[NLP] Interactive Storytelling with Dynamic Character Adaptation using Diffusion Models
This research explores the integration of diffusion models for generating dynamic character adaptations within interactive storytelling, addressing the challenge of maintaining consistent character voice and personality across evolving narratives. It will leverage a transformer-based model fine-tuned on a diverse dataset of interactive fiction, evaluating coherence, character consistency, and engagement through human ratings and automated metrics like perplexity and narrative length.

[NLP] Multi-Modal Storytelling with Adaptive Visual Style
This project investigates a system that dynamically adjusts the visual style of interactive stories based on the user’s emotional response, leveraging a diffusion model and reinforcement learning to create a more immersive and emotionally resonant experience. It will focus on enhancing narrative coherence and engagement through adaptive visual cues.

[NLP] Personalized Narrative Coherence via Emotional Resonance Modeling
This project explores a novel approach to interactive storytelling by dynamically adjusting the narrative style based on the user’s emotional response to the story’s content. The system will utilize a transformer model fine-tuned on user-generated stories, incorporating sentiment analysis to identify emotional peaks and valleys. Evaluation will be based on average user ratings and qualitative analysis of user responses.

[ML] Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Drone Path Planning in Urban Environments

This research will develop a reinforcement learning agent to autonomously plan and execute flight paths for a small drone within a complex urban environment, optimizing for safety, efficiency, and obstacle avoidance. The agent will be trained using a simulated environment incorporating diverse urban obstacles and dynamic lighting conditions. Evaluation will be based on metrics such as path length, time to completion, and collision rate.

[ML] Adversarial Training for Robust Object Detection in Low-Light Conditions

This research focuses on developing robust object detection models that perform reliably in challenging low-light environments. We will explore adversarial training techniques to improve the model’s resilience to noise and illumination variations, potentially enhancing performance in applications like autonomous driving or surveillance. Data will include a diverse set of images captured in varying lighting conditions, and evaluation will be based on mean Average Precision (mAP) across multiple low-light scenarios.

[HCI] Context-Aware Navigation Assistant for Seniors with Fall Risk

This research develops a mobile application that provides contextual navigation assistance to seniors, incorporating real-time sensor data (IMUs, cameras) and personalized risk assessments to proactively mitigate fall risks. The system will utilize machine learning to predict potential falls based on gait patterns and environmental factors, offering gentle guidance and alerts to the user and caregivers. Evaluation will involve a randomized controlled trial with seniors, measuring fall incidence, navigation accuracy, and user satisfaction.

[Cognitive Science] Embodied Emotional Response Modeling with Virtual Agents - Exploring the Role of Predictive Coding in Simulated Surgical Training

This research will investigate how embodied interaction – simulating physical actions and gestures – influences the accuracy of virtual agents in simulating surgical training. We will use a hierarchical reinforcement learning approach to train an agent to generate responses that are not only engaging but also accurately reflect the user’s underlying emotional state, incorporating both visual cues and physiological data. Metrics will include accuracy of emotional state prediction and subjective ratings of emotional engagement.

[Safety] Visual Grounding for Bias Detection in Personalized Recommendation Systems - A Hybrid Approach

This research will develop a hybrid approach combining visual grounding with traditional bias detection techniques to improve the accuracy and robustness of personalized recommendation systems. We will build a system that analyzes user interaction data and visual cues within the environment, comparing these representations to user-reported preferences to identify potential biases. Evaluation will involve measuring the system’s accuracy in identifying and flagging biased recommendations, focusing on both quantitative and qualitative assessments.

[NLP] Explainable Sentiment Analysis with Visual Grounding

This research will develop an explainable sentiment analysis system that integrates visual grounding to provide users with insights into *why* a sentiment is being assigned. It will build a system that analyzes text alongside visual cues (e.g., facial expressions, object recognition) to provide a richer understanding of sentiment, enhancing transparency and trust. Data will include text and associated visual data, and evaluation will be based on accuracy, interpretability, and user satisfaction.

[Vision]  Dynamic Scene Graph Generation for Robotic Navigation

This research will develop a system that automatically generates a dynamic scene graph from visual input, representing the relationships between objects in a given environment. The system will leverage a visual transformer to extract scene features and a graph generation algorithm to create a structured representation of the scene. I will evaluate the system using a set of simulated navigation tasks, measuring success rate and path planning efficiency.

[Vision]  Visual-Guided Robot Manipulation Planning with Implicit Scene Understanding

This research investigates a method for robot manipulation planning that leverages implicit scene understanding – inferred relationships between objects and their environment – to guide action selection. It will utilize a visual transformer to learn a representation of the scene, incorporating object properties and spatial relationships, and then generate a sequence of actions that a robot can execute, improving robustness to partial observations. Evaluation will be based on success rate of successful manipulation tasks, measured by the number of successful grasp events and the time taken to complete the task.

[ML] Personalized Irrigation Scheduling using Soil Moisture and Weather Data

This project aims to develop a system that uses soil moisture sensors and weather data to automatically adjust irrigation schedules for agricultural fields, optimizing water usage and minimizing water waste. The system will utilize a recurrent neural network (RNN) to learn patterns in soil moisture, weather conditions, and crop water needs, allowing for adaptive irrigation strategies. Evaluation will be based on water savings, crop yield, and the accuracy of irrigation recommendations compared to traditional methods.

[HCI] Dynamic UI Adaptation for Multi-Modal Navigation: Leveraging Eye-Tracking and Contextual Audio

This research investigates how dynamic UI adaptation can be implemented within a mobile navigation app to optimize user experience, particularly in complex or ambiguous environments. It will develop a system that adjusts the app’s visual layout and audio cues based on real-time eye-tracking data and contextual audio cues (e.g., traffic noise, pedestrian presence) to reduce cognitive load and improve route adherence. Evaluation will involve measuring task completion rates, user error rates, and subjective user ratings of usability and comfort.

[NLP] Personalized Mental Health Support Chatbot using Emotion Recognition and Dialogue Management
This research will develop a chatbot that utilizes emotion recognition from user text and voice input to provide personalized support and guidance for individuals experiencing mild to moderate mental health challenges. The chatbot will employ a transformer-based model for emotion recognition and a reinforcement learning agent to optimize dialogue flow and empathetic responses. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction, symptom reduction, and engagement metrics.

[Safety] Dynamic Risk Assessment for Public Transportation Using Multi-Sensor Data

This research proposes a system that dynamically assesses risk levels in public transportation environments using a combination of video data, accelerometer data, and potentially audio analysis. The system will leverage computer vision to detect potential hazards like dropped objects, obstructed pathways, and unusual behavior, combined with sensor data to refine risk assessments. Evaluation will involve simulating real-world scenarios and measuring the system’s accuracy in predicting and alerting users to potential safety risks, focusing on minimizing passenger injury.

[NLP] Adaptive Persona Generation for Virtual Assistants using Reinforcement Learning

This research will develop an adaptive persona generation system for virtual assistants, using reinforcement learning to optimize the assistant’s personality and communication style based on user feedback. The system will learn to generate responses that are both engaging and aligned with the user’s expressed preferences, improving user satisfaction and perceived helpfulness. Data will include user interaction logs and explicit feedback on persona attributes. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction scores and task completion rates.

[NLP] Contextual Sentiment Shift Detection with Visual-Textual Fusion

This research will develop a system that analyzes the sentiment expressed within a conversation, identifying shifts in sentiment that indicate a user is becoming frustrated or dissatisfied with the AI’s responses. I will build a model leveraging transformer networks to detect subtle changes in sentiment expressed through word choice, emoji usage, and conversational tone, and will evaluate performance using a held-out dataset of user-AI conversations labeled with sentiment scores.

[NLP] Interactive Narrative Generation with Dynamic Character Consistency

This research will develop a system that generates interactive narratives where character consistency is maintained across multiple turns of dialogue, leveraging a neural latent model to represent character traits and emotional states. It will build a system that allows users to influence the narrative through choices, and the model will ensure that character actions and dialogue align with established personality profiles, evaluated using coherence metrics and user satisfaction surveys.

[NLP] Personalized Knowledge Graph Construction via Contextual Attention

This research will develop a system that automatically constructs and updates a personalized knowledge graph for a user based on their current context and goals, using a transformer-based model to dynamically attend to relevant knowledge sources. The system will leverage user-provided feedback and a dynamic knowledge graph schema to improve the accuracy and relevance of the knowledge graph over time. Data will include user queries, interaction history, and explicit feedback on knowledge graph representations. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction (measured through surveys) and the accuracy of knowledge graph predictions.

[NLP] Dynamic Dialogue State Tracking with Contextual Sentiment Analysis

This research focuses on developing a system that continuously tracks the dynamic state of a conversation – including user intent, emotional cues, and contextual information – to improve dialogue management and personalization. It will employ a transformer-based model trained on a diverse dataset of multi-turn dialogues, incorporating contextual embeddings to capture nuanced conversational dynamics. Evaluation will be based on metrics like Mean Reciprocal Rank (MRR) and human evaluation of dialogue coherence and user satisfaction.

[NLP] Interactive Storytelling with Emotional Response Modeling

This project explores the integration of emotional response modeling into interactive storytelling platforms, allowing users to influence the narrative through their emotional state. We will develop a system that analyzes user facial expressions and voice tone to dynamically adjust the story’s plot, character interactions, and emotional tone, creating a personalized and immersive experience. Data will include user facial expression data (using a webcam) and voice tone analysis. Evaluation will be based on user engagement metrics (time spent, completion rate, and subjective ratings of enjoyment).

[Cognitive Science] Exploring the Role of Predictive Coding in Social Memory Consolidation

This research investigates how predictive coding mechanisms influence the consolidation of social memories – memories of interactions with specific individuals. I will design a controlled experiment using a virtual environment where participants are presented with a series of short, ambiguous social interactions. Participants will be asked to rate the emotional valence of each interaction and to predict the participant’s next action. I will then analyze the neural activity in the prefrontal cortex during these predictions, looking for patterns that correlate with the strength of the memory trace. The goal is to determine if predictive coding biases memory consolidation towards more emotionally salient and predictable social events. The study will utilize fMRI to examine neural activity associated with bias detection and consolidation.

[NLP] Emotionally-Responsive Narrative Generation – Develop a system that dynamically adjusts the narrative’s tone and complexity based on user’s emotional state detected through facial expression analysis, enhancing engagement and emotional impact. Data will include facial expression data, narrative text, and user ratings. Evaluation will involve subjective ratings of emotional engagement and narrative coherence.

[NLP] Explainable AI for Personalized Storytelling – Develop a system that uses attention mechanisms to highlight specific emotional cues within a user’s narrative, providing insights into why the AI is generating a particular response, improving user understanding and trust. Data will include narrative text, user ratings, and facial expression data. Evaluation will be based on user comprehension and perceived emotional impact.

[Vision] Personalized Emotional Response Generation through Visual Cue Integration

This research investigates the integration of visual cues – specifically facial expressions and body language – with a multimodal model to generate personalized emotional responses in interactive narratives. The model will learn to associate specific visual patterns with corresponding emotional states, allowing for dynamic adaptation of the narrative’s tone and pacing based on the user’s emotional state. Data will include a dataset of human interactions with narratives, annotated with emotional labels and corresponding visual cues. Evaluation will be based on user ratings of emotional engagement and narrative coherence.

[NLP] Knowledge Graph-Guided Dialogue Refinement for Virtual Assistants
This research proposes a system that utilizes knowledge graphs to dynamically refine dialogue responses in virtual assistants, improving coherence and relevance to user intent. The system will analyze user utterances and the knowledge graph to identify potential inconsistencies or ambiguities, suggesting alternative dialogue paths and refining responses to ensure a more natural and helpful interaction. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction scores and task completion rates.

[ML] Interactive Visual Reasoning for Autonomous Navigation in Dynamic Environments

This research will develop a system that allows an autonomous vehicle to reason about its surroundings and plan navigation paths in real-time, incorporating visual information and contextual understanding. The system will utilize a combination of visual perception, object detection, and path planning algorithms, incorporating a knowledge graph to represent scene understanding and potential obstacles. Evaluation will be based on successful navigation through dynamic environments with minimal human intervention.

[ML] Few-Shot Learning for Autonomous Driving in Urban Environments with Limited Pedestrian Data

This research will develop a few-shot learning framework for autonomous driving in urban environments, leveraging a small dataset of pedestrian behavior captured through camera feeds. We will train a model to predict pedestrian trajectories and intentions using only a few labeled examples, focusing on generalization to unseen pedestrian behaviors and diverse urban settings. Evaluation will be based on metrics like Mean Average Precision (mAP) and Intersection over Union (IoU) for pedestrian detection and trajectory prediction.

[HCI] Dynamic Embodied Navigation: Adaptive Feedback for Spatial Awareness

This research proposes a system that dynamically adjusts haptic feedback based on the user’s real-time spatial awareness and perceived movement, aiming to reduce cognitive load and improve navigation accuracy. It will utilize a combination of inertial measurement units (IMUs) and visual cues to create a personalized feedback loop, adapting to the user’s current position and orientation. Evaluation will involve subjective user ratings of navigation confidence and ease of use, as well as objective metrics such as path deviation and time to reach destination.

[NLP] Sentiment-Aware Dialogue Summarization for User Engagement

This research investigates a method for automatically generating concise summaries of long dialogue transcripts, incorporating sentiment analysis to highlight user engagement and potential areas of interest. We will develop a model that not only extracts key events but also assesses the emotional tone of the user's responses, providing a richer understanding of their satisfaction and intent. Data: Collection of dialogue transcripts from a simulated user base. Evaluation: ROUGE scores, human evaluation of summary quality (engagement, clarity).

[Safety] Explainable AI for Automated Loan Denial Decisions

This research focuses on developing methods to provide transparency and justification for automated loan denial decisions, addressing concerns about fairness and potential discrimination. We will build a system that analyzes loan application data (including applicant demographics, credit history, and income) and generates a detailed, human-readable explanation of the factors contributing to the denial, using techniques like rule-based reasoning and potentially incorporating fairness metrics. Evaluation will involve comparing the system’s explanations to those provided by human loan officers and assessing their accuracy and comprehensibility.

[NLP] Personalized Narrative Generation for User Engagement

This research will develop a system that generates unique, personalized narratives tailored to individual user preferences and emotional states, using a combination of sentiment analysis and reinforcement learning. The system will analyze user activity and emotional responses to dynamically adjust the narrative's tone, complexity, and content, aiming to increase user engagement and satisfaction.

[NLP] Interactive Visual Storytelling with Emotionally Aware Agents

This research will develop an interactive storytelling system where an agent responds to user gaze and emotional cues, dynamically adjusting the narrative’s tone and complexity to enhance engagement and emotional impact. The system will utilize a combination of visual scene description, sentiment analysis, and reinforcement learning to create a personalized and responsive storytelling experience. Evaluation will be based on user engagement metrics (time spent, completion rate) and subjective ratings of emotional response.

[NLP] Contrastive Learning for Medical Image Segmentation – Developing a Robust and Interpretable Segmentation Metric

This research proposes a contrastive learning framework for medical image segmentation, focusing on learning robust and interpretable segmentation metrics that can be easily understood by clinicians. The system will train a contrastive network to learn representations of segmented regions, and will evaluate performance using a combination of visual inspection and human evaluation. Evaluation will be based on metrics like Dice score and Hausdorff distance, alongside qualitative assessments of segmentation accuracy and consistency.
[NLP] Interactive Storytelling with Dynamic Emotional Adaptation using Visual Sentiment Analysis

[Vision]  Interactive Storytelling with Visual Scene Understanding
This research explores the integration of visual scene understanding into interactive storytelling platforms, enabling more dynamic and responsive narratives. The system will leverage a pre-trained visual model to analyze the scene depicted in the story, dynamically adjusting the narrative based on visual cues. Evaluation will focus on coherence and engagement, measured through user ratings and qualitative feedback.

[Vision]  Predictive Comfort Modeling for Elderly Home Environments - Utilizing Visual Data to Anticipate User Needs

This research will develop a system that uses computer vision and machine learning to predict user comfort levels within a home environment based on visual data (e.g., lighting, temperature, furniture arrangement). The system will analyze visual cues to identify potential discomfort triggers and proactively adjust environmental settings to optimize user well-being. Evaluation will involve user testing with elderly individuals, measuring subjective comfort ratings and behavioral responses to automated adjustments.

[Cognitive Science] Exploring the Role of Implicit Social Evaluation in Episodic Memory Consolidation – A Longitudinal Study

This research will conduct a longitudinal study examining the impact of repeated implicit social evaluation on episodic memory consolidation. We will use fMRI to assess neural activity during simulated social interactions, tracking changes in brain regions associated with reward processing and social cognition. The goal is to determine if repeated implicit evaluations of a person’s behavior strengthen the encoding of relevant episodic memories, leading to improved recall and a more robust understanding of how social evaluation shapes memory formation. Data will include behavioral measures of social evaluation (e.g., facial expressions, verbal comments) and fMRI data capturing neural responses to simulated social interactions.
[NLP] Personalized Emotional Response Adaptation for Mental Health Support Chatbots

[NLP] Interactive Storytelling with Dynamic Character Alignment
This research investigates a system that dynamically aligns character personalities and motivations within interactive storytelling experiences, adapting to user choices in real-time. We will develop a model that uses reinforcement learning to optimize character behavior based on user feedback and narrative events, enhancing engagement and creating a more immersive experience. Data will include user choices, narrative events, and explicit feedback on character alignment. Evaluation will be based on user engagement metrics (time spent, completion rate) and subjective ratings of character believability and emotional impact.

[Vision] Embodied Dialogue Understanding with Action Prediction

This research explores the integration of action prediction models with visual grounding to enhance dialogue understanding, particularly in scenarios involving physical actions or interactions. We will train a model to predict the user’s intended action based on visual cues, allowing the system to better anticipate and respond to their actions, leading to more natural and efficient conversations. Evaluation will be based on metrics like task completion rate and user satisfaction.

[NLP] Personalized Storytelling with Dynamic Character Adaptation using Attention Networks
This research investigates a system that generates personalized stories by dynamically adapting character personalities and storylines based on user emotional responses and engagement, utilizing a neural network to learn and adjust these parameters in real-time. It will be evaluated on a dataset of user-generated stories, measuring coherence, emotional resonance, and user engagement metrics.
[NLP] Explainable Reinforcement Learning for Counter-Narrative Detection

[NLP] Dynamic Persona Generation for Counter-Narrative Response in Social Media – A Multi-Agent System
This research proposes a system that utilizes a multi-agent approach to generate dynamic personas for counter-narratives in social media, responding to user-generated content. The system will leverage a large dataset of social media posts and automatically generate personas representing opposing viewpoints, then dynamically adjust these personas based on user engagement to create a more effective counter-narrative. Evaluation will be based on user sentiment analysis of the counter-narrative and a measure of engagement (e.g., shares, comments).

[HCI] Contextualized Emotional Response Generation for Virtual Assistants

This research investigates the development of a virtual assistant that can dynamically adjust its emotional tone and response style based on the user’s expressed emotional state, using a combination of sentiment analysis and reinforcement learning. The system will analyze user voice and text input to detect emotional cues and generate responses that reflect empathy and understanding, improving user satisfaction and trust. Data will include user voice recordings, text transcripts, and explicit feedback ratings. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction surveys, task completion rates, and analysis of conversation flow.

[NLP] Personalized Emotional Response Generation for Interactive Storytelling

This research explores the use of a fine-tuned transformer model to generate emotionally nuanced responses within interactive storytelling platforms. The model will be trained on a dataset of narrative text and associated emotional labels, allowing it to adapt its responses to the user's emotional state and the story's context. Evaluation will be based on user ratings of emotional engagement and coherence within the narrative.

[Safety] AI-Powered Contextual Risk Assessment for Emergency Response – Integrating Social Media and Sensor Data

This research will develop an AI system that analyzes real-time social media data (e.g., posts, hashtags) and sensor data (e.g., traffic, pedestrian movement) to provide contextual risk assessments for emergency responders, considering the social and physical environment. The system will leverage a transformer model to identify potential hazards and prioritize response efforts, evaluating effectiveness through a metric of reduced response times and improved situational awareness. Data will include social media posts, traffic sensor data, and emergency call logs.
[NLP]  Personalized Emotional Response Modeling via Facial Expression and Vocal Cue Integration for Therapeutic Chatbots

[NLP] Interactive Visual-Textual Emotion Recognition for Personalized Support Systems

This research focuses on creating a system that dynamically adjusts support responses based on a user’s visual and textual cues, aiming to improve empathy and engagement through a seamless integration of multimodal information. We will build a model that analyzes both the user’s expressed emotion (via facial expressions and text) and the context of the conversation (via dialogue history), using a transformer-based architecture to generate tailored responses. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction scores and metrics measuring the effectiveness of the system in promoting emotional connection.

[NLP] Longitudinal Dialogue Analysis for User Behavior Modeling
This research investigates the development of a system that tracks user behavior across multiple dialogue turns to build a more accurate and nuanced model of user preferences and intentions. We will utilize a combination of session-based analysis and recurrent neural networks to capture temporal dependencies and identify evolving user goals. We will evaluate the model’s ability to predict user actions and engagement using metrics like session length, topic diversity, and task completion rate.

[NLP] Contextualized Sentiment Analysis for Scientific Report Generation

This research aims to develop a system that automatically generates concise and informative summaries of scientific reports, incorporating contextual sentiment analysis to ensure the report accurately reflects the author's intended message and audience. We will use a transformer-based model fine-tuned on a dataset of scientific reports and their associated sentiment scores. Evaluation will be based on human assessment of report clarity, accuracy, and persuasiveness, as well as automated metrics like ROUGE and BLEU for summarization quality.

[NLP] Interactive Storytelling with Dynamic Character Adaptation using Transformer Networks

This research explores the integration of transformer networks to dynamically adapt character personalities and storylines within interactive storytelling experiences. The system will utilize a pre-trained transformer model to generate character dialogue and actions, with the network learning to adjust the character’s emotional state and behavior based on user feedback and contextual cues. Evaluation will be based on user engagement metrics (e.g., time spent, completion rate) and subjective ratings of narrative coherence and emotional impact.

[HCI] Adaptive Emotional Resonance Profiles – Dynamic Prompt Generation for Character Consistency

This research explores a system that dynamically generates narrative prompts based on real-time user emotional feedback, creating ‘emotional resonance profiles’ for each character. The system will utilize a transformer model to analyze user sentiment and generate prompts that subtly guide the character’s emotional arc, ensuring consistent emotional consistency across interactions. The evaluation will focus on subjective user ratings of narrative coherence and emotional impact, alongside automated metrics like sentiment analysis of generated dialogue.
[NLP] Context-Aware Emotional Resonance Modeling with Adaptive Narrative Generation

[NLP] Contextualized Sentiment Analysis of Product Reviews with Knowledge Graph Integration

This research will develop a system that enhances sentiment analysis by incorporating a knowledge graph to understand the relationships between product features, user reviews, and expert knowledge. It will improve accuracy and provide deeper insights into product sentiment compared to traditional methods. Evaluation will involve human evaluation of the system’s ability to identify key product features driving sentiment.

[NLP] Personalized Dialogue Generation for Mental Health Support Chatbots

This research will develop a dialogue generation model specifically tailored for mental health chatbots, focusing on empathetic and supportive responses. The model will utilize a transformer architecture trained on a dataset of therapeutic conversations, incorporating reinforcement learning to optimize for user engagement and emotional well-being. Evaluation will be based on user surveys assessing perceived empathy, helpfulness, and overall satisfaction.

[NLP]  Counterfactual Story Generation with Bias Mitigation
This research explores the development of a counterfactual story generation model that explicitly mitigates biases present in training data. It will utilize a transformer architecture trained on a diverse dataset, incorporating techniques like counterfactual augmentation and adversarial debiasing to generate stories that reflect a more equitable representation of different demographic groups. Evaluation will be based on metrics like diversity of generated narratives and fairness across demographic groups.

[NLP] Explainable Sentiment Analysis for Customer Service Interactions

This research investigates the development of an explainable sentiment analysis model specifically tailored for analyzing customer service interactions (e.g., chat logs, call transcripts). The model will leverage attention mechanisms to highlight the parts of the text that contribute most to the sentiment, and will provide insights into *why* a customer is expressing a particular sentiment. Data will be collected from a simulated customer service platform, and evaluation will be based on metrics like precision, recall, and F1-score, alongside human evaluation of the model’s explanations.

[NLP] Adaptive Dialogue Style Transfer for Emotional Support Chatbots

This research focuses on developing chatbots that can dynamically adjust their conversational style to better match the user's emotional state, improving empathy and rapport. We will train a model to analyze user sentiment through text and speech, and then generate responses that reflect the user's emotional tone, incorporating techniques like sentiment-aware paraphrasing and emotional modulation. Evaluation will be based on user ratings of empathy, rapport, and perceived helpfulness.
[HCI] Embodied Conversational Agents for Mental Health Support

[NLP] Contextualized Sentiment-Driven Worldbuilding

This research investigates a system that dynamically generates and adapts worldbuilding elements – including cultures, histories, and societal structures – based on a user’s expressed preferences and emotional responses to a narrative. The system will utilize a large language model to generate initial worldbuilding details, then iteratively refine them based on user feedback and emotional indicators derived from their responses. Evaluation will focus on the coherence and believability of the generated world, as well as the user’s perceived emotional engagement with the world.

[NLP] Interactive Narrative Coherence with Ethical Constraints

This research explores a system that dynamically adjusts the narrative coherence and ethical constraints of interactive stories, leveraging a transformer model to ensure consistent adherence to predefined moral guidelines and preventing harmful or biased storylines. It will utilize a dataset of stories annotated with ethical principles and evaluate the system’s ability to maintain coherence and avoid problematic content through automated analysis and human feedback.

[NLP] Personalized Emotional Storytelling with Adaptive Character Reactions
This research investigates the use of a transformer model to dynamically adjust the emotional responses and dialogue of virtual characters based on user input and observed emotional states, creating a more engaging and empathetic experience. We will evaluate the system’s effectiveness through user surveys and physiological data analysis, focusing on improved user engagement and perceived emotional connection. Neighbor (6, 9) [score=0.88, last_updated=7] provides a good starting point for emotional simulation, and this adaptation will build upon its ability to respond to nuanced user cues.

[NLP] Interactive Narrative Generation with Dynamic Character Motivation
This research explores the integration of reinforcement learning with a narrative generation model to create interactive stories where character motivations dynamically shift based on player choices and observed emotional responses. We will train a model to generate branching narratives with evolving character goals, utilizing a combination of reinforcement learning and emotional state detection.

[NLP] Explainable Sentiment Analysis of Online Reviews with Attention Mechanisms
This research investigates the use of attention mechanisms within transformer-based models to improve the explainability of sentiment analysis performed on online reviews. It will focus on identifying the specific parts of the review text that contribute most to the overall sentiment, allowing for a more granular understanding of why a review is positive or negative. Evaluation will be based on human evaluation of the model’s explanations, measuring their coherence, relevance, and faithfulness to the review text.

[NLP] Interactive Narrative Therapy for Trauma-Related Anxiety using Generative Adversarial Networks
This research will develop a system that utilizes Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) to dynamically generate personalized narrative sequences for trauma-related anxiety patients, fostering a sense of agency and reducing feelings of helplessness. Evaluation will involve assessing user engagement with the narrative therapy through questionnaires and qualitative interviews, measuring perceived emotional relief and improved coping skills.

[NLP] Contextualized Sentiment Analysis of Chat Logs with Dialogue Act Detection
This research proposes a system that analyzes customer support chat logs by not only identifying sentiment but also detecting the *intent* behind the message – whether it’s a question, a complaint, a request, or something else. It will leverage a transformer model fine-tuned on labeled chat data, incorporating dialogue act detection to provide a richer understanding of the conversation’s purpose. The evaluation will measure the accuracy of intent classification compared to human annotations.

[HCI] Adaptive Visual Feedback for Remote Collaboration – A Personalized System for Reducing Miscommunication

This research develops a system that dynamically adjusts visual cues (e.g., highlighting, color changes) based on individual team member communication styles and perceived emotional states, aiming to minimize miscommunication and improve collaboration in remote settings. The system will utilize speech and facial expression analysis, combined with a reinforcement learning algorithm to optimize feedback delivery. Evaluation will be based on team satisfaction scores and reduced instances of misunderstandings.

[Cognitive Science] Exploring the Impact of Implicit Bias on Collaborative Problem-Solving in Virtual Teams

This research investigates how implicit biases – unconscious stereotypes – affect team dynamics and collaborative problem-solving in virtual teams, specifically focusing on communication patterns and decision-making processes. I will develop a simulation model that incorporates implicit bias detection and mitigation strategies, evaluating their impact on team performance and conflict resolution. The model will utilize a combination of sentiment analysis and behavioral observation to assess team communication and identify potential biases. Evaluation will be based on team task completion rates, conflict resolution effectiveness, and subjective team member perceptions of fairness.

[HCI] Interactive Narrative Simulation for Trauma Recovery

This research develops an interactive narrative experience designed to help individuals process traumatic memories through a carefully constructed, branching story. The system will utilize NLP to generate dynamic responses based on user choices, incorporating elements of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) principles. Evaluation will be based on standardized trauma assessment tools and subjective user reports of emotional regulation and narrative engagement.

[Vision]  Explainable AI (XAI) for Medical Image Diagnosis using Attention Maps

This research explores the application of attention maps derived from convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to provide explainable insights into the diagnostic reasoning of medical image analysis models. We will develop a method to visualize and interpret the attention weights assigned to different regions of an image, allowing clinicians to understand which features the model is focusing on when making a diagnosis. Evaluation will be based on human evaluation of the clarity and usefulness of the explanations, as well as quantitative metrics like accuracy and sensitivity of the model’s predictions.

[NLP]  Dynamic Dialogue Style Adaptation for Complex Scientific Concepts

This research investigates a system that dynamically adjusts the language and complexity of a dialogue system to effectively convey complex scientific concepts to a diverse audience. It will utilize a transformer model fine-tuned on a corpus of scientific papers and expert explanations, incorporating visual aids (e.g., diagrams) to enhance understanding. Evaluation will be based on comprehension tests and user feedback on perceived clarity and engagement.

[NLP] Context-Aware Character Modeling with Uncertainty Quantification
This research explores the development of a novel character modeling approach that incorporates uncertainty quantification during dialogue generation. It leverages a transformer-based model and a Bayesian approach to estimate the model's confidence in its predictions, allowing for more nuanced and believable character interactions. Evaluation will be based on user ratings of coherence, emotional depth, and believability, measured using a Likert scale.

[NLP] Adaptive Knowledge Synthesis for Scientific Discovery
This research proposes a system that dynamically adapts the synthesis of scientific knowledge based on a researcher’s current understanding and the specific context of a research question. It utilizes a hybrid approach combining retrieval-augmented generation with a knowledge graph embedding technique, evaluating its ability to improve the speed and accuracy of scientific discovery through simulated experimental results.

[HCI] Adaptive Navigation Interface for Elderly Users – Leveraging Predictive Vibration Feedback

This research proposes a novel navigation interface specifically designed for elderly users, incorporating predictive vibration feedback to enhance situational awareness and reduce cognitive load. The system will analyze accelerometer data to detect gait changes indicative of disorientation or reduced stability, providing subtle vibration cues to alert the user and adjust route recommendations accordingly. Evaluation will focus on user task completion rates, error rates, and subjective measures of comfort and confidence. Metrics will include frequency of successful navigation and user reported feelings of safety and ease of use.

[HCI] Predictive Vibration-Guided Dynamic Route Adjustment for Cognitive Impairment

This research explores the use of haptic feedback to dynamically adjust route recommendations in mobile navigation apps, specifically targeting users with cognitive impairments. The system will analyze gait patterns and predict potential navigational challenges, providing subtle vibrations to guide the user towards safer and more efficient routes. Data will include gait data, user feedback, and a database of known cognitive impairment scenarios. Evaluation will be based on subjective user ratings of route clarity and ease of use, as well as objective metrics like time to reach destination and error rate.

[NLP] Interactive Storytelling with Dynamic Emotional Adaptation - A System for Personalized Narrative Engagement

This research will develop an interactive storytelling platform that dynamically adjusts the narrative based on the user’s emotional state, utilizing a transformer model to analyze sentiment and modify plot points, character interactions, and emotional cues in real-time. Evaluation will be based on user engagement metrics (time spent, completion rate), subjective ratings of emotional impact, and a validated emotion recognition scale.

[NLP] Personalized Emotional Feedback System for Creative Writing

This research will develop a system that analyzes a writer’s creative text – including prose, poetry, and scripts – to provide personalized feedback on emotional tone and engagement, using a transformer model to identify and quantify emotional states. Evaluation will be based on subjective human ratings of emotional impact and stylistic coherence, measured using a Likert scale.
[NLP] Contextualized Knowledge Graph Reasoning with Uncertainty Modeling

[NLP] Personalized Narrative Generation for Scientific Communication

This research aims to develop a system that automatically generates personalized narratives tailored to different audiences when communicating scientific findings. It will leverage a transformer model fine-tuned on a corpus of scientific publications and expert summaries, adapting the narrative style and level of detail to match the reader’s background and expertise. Evaluation will be based on readability scores, comprehension tests, and user feedback on perceived clarity and engagement.

[NLP] Explainable AI for Creative Writing Style Transfer

This research explores the use of transformer models to transfer the stylistic characteristics of one creative writing style to another, focusing on evaluating the coherence and aesthetic quality of the transferred style. We will use a dataset of short stories and analyze the model's output using metrics like perplexity and human evaluation of stylistic similarity.

[HCI] Personalized Dialogue System for Virtual Therapy

This research investigates the design of a dialogue system that adapts its conversational style and therapeutic approach based on a user’s emotional state and expressed needs, enhancing the effectiveness of virtual therapy sessions. Data will include user-reported emotional responses, session transcripts, and potentially physiological signals (e.g., heart rate variability) to train a personalized therapeutic model. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction, session completion rates, and validated therapeutic outcomes.

[Cognitive Psychology] Personalized Route Preference Shaping through Attention Dynamics

This research investigates how individual differences in visual attention influence route preference and adherence, proposing a system that dynamically adjusts route recommendations based on predicted attentional shifts. Data will include eye-tracking, route tracking, and user-reported attention levels. Evaluation will be based on subjective user ratings of route adherence and perceived cognitive effort.

[Safety] Autonomous Vehicle Route Optimization with Predictive Risk Assessment

This research explores the integration of predictive risk assessment models into autonomous vehicle route planning, focusing on identifying and mitigating potential hazards based on the user’s observed gait and environmental context. It will develop a system that analyzes accelerometer and gyroscope data to predict potential collisions and adjust route parameters accordingly, enhancing safety and reducing the risk of accidents. Evaluation will involve simulated driving scenarios and real-world testing with a focus on collision avoidance and passenger safety.

[NLP] Dynamic Route Adaptation via Predictive Vibration Mapping and Sensor Fusion

This research investigates a system that dynamically adapts route recommendations in real-time by fusing predictive vibration mapping with data from a smartphone’s accelerometer and gyroscope. The system will learn user gait patterns and predict navigational challenges, proactively adjusting route suggestions to minimize disorientation. Data will include accelerometer and gyroscope readings, along with user feedback on route choices. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction (measured via a post-route survey) and the accuracy of route adjustments.

[Vision] Interactive Visual-Textual Crisis Detection with Adaptive Attention

This research explores a system that dynamically adjusts the level of attention given to visual and textual cues during crisis detection, leveraging a transformer model to prioritize the most relevant information. The system will utilize a dataset of social media posts and corresponding images, and evaluate performance using a custom metric combining precision and recall on crisis prediction tasks.

[NLP] Personalized Crisis Response via Multi-Modal Contextualization
This research will design a system that analyzes social media posts, visual cues, and textual context to provide personalized crisis response recommendations, utilizing a transformer model to dynamically adjust the relevance of each input modality. Evaluation will focus on the accuracy and timeliness of suggested interventions, measured by a user-defined metric of response effectiveness.

[NLP] Contextualized Emotional Response Generation for Therapeutic Chatbots - Utilizing Sentiment Analysis and Dialogue History

This research will develop a chatbot system that generates empathetic and supportive responses based on the user’s current emotional state, incorporating their past conversation history and contextual cues. The system will leverage a transformer model fine-tuned on a dataset of therapeutic dialogues to ensure responses are sensitive and appropriate. Evaluation will be based on user satisfaction scores, measured through questionnaires assessing perceived empathy and helpfulness, alongside analysis of conversation flow and emotional coherence.

[NLP] Personalized Storytelling with Dynamic Plot Generation

This research explores the use of a transformer-based model to dynamically generate personalized stories based on user preferences and emotional states. The model learns to create narratives with branching storylines and character arcs tailored to individual user input, enhancing engagement and emotional impact. Data: A dataset of user-generated stories and emotional responses. Evaluation: User ratings of story coherence, emotional resonance, and personalization. Metrics: Average rating, sentiment analysis of user feedback.

[HCI] Embodied Navigation Assistant for Mobile Gaming

This research explores the design of an embodied navigation assistant for mobile games, utilizing a combination of visual SLAM and reinforcement learning to guide players through complex environments. It will focus on creating a system that dynamically adapts to player behavior and environmental changes, providing intuitive and efficient navigation assistance, ultimately enhancing the player experience and reducing frustration. Data will include player movement data, game environment data (e.g., map layouts, obstacles), and metrics such as navigation success rate, time spent navigating, and player satisfaction scores.

[Safety] Predictive Policing Algorithm for Resource Allocation – A Simulation Study

This research will develop a simulation-based model to evaluate the effectiveness of predictive policing algorithms in allocating police resources across a city. The model will incorporate historical crime data, demographic information, and environmental factors to predict potential crime hotspots. We will assess the model’s accuracy in identifying high-risk areas, its impact on resource deployment, and its potential for reinforcing existing biases. Evaluation will be based on metrics such as resource utilization, crime rates in predicted areas, and fairness metrics comparing predicted vs. actual crime rates across different demographic groups.
